intro: Cycnium chevalieri, commonly known as the Italian water hemp, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa, where it thrives in moist, disturbed soils. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in umbels. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a distinctive, aromatic scent. Cycnium chevalieri is often found near water bodies and is adapted to wetland environments.
